summary: This is an email chain between contractors and a U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the electronic discovery production for the 'We Build the Wall' case. It reveals that the 'Epstein production' is consuming significant resources and causing delays for other cases due to a pending discovery deadline.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial request for the We Build the Wall discovery production, providing instructions and a deadline.

events.title: Court Conference for We Build the Wall case
events.description: A scheduled court conference for the We Build the Wall case, mentioned as a reason to expedite the discovery production.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email chain is about managing electronic discovery for the 'We Build the Wall' case in the Southern District of New York.
A contractor explicitly states that the 'Epstein production is currently taking up a lot of resources right now due to their pending discovery deadline,' indicating it is impacting other cases.
The production involves documents from specific search warrant returns dated January 2, 2020, and July 6 & 13, 2020.
The correspondence shows the logistical challenges of coordinating large-scale document production between legal teams and contractors.
